{{also|对牛弹琴}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=对牛弹琴|type=112|lit=playing the [[zither]] to a cow}}

===Etymology===
From the story of the {{w|Warring States}}-era musician Gongming Yi ({{lang|zh|公明儀}}) playing the zither to a cow, recorded in ''{{w|Mouzi Lihuolun}}'' {{defdate|circa 3rd century {{CE}}}}.

{{zh-pron
|m=duìniútánqín
|c=deoi3 ngau4 taan4 kam4
|mn=tùi-gû-tôaⁿ-khîm
|cat=cy
}}

===Idiom===
{{zh-idiom}}

# like talking to a [[brick wall]]; like [[cast pearls before swine|casting pearls before swine]]; [[offer]]ing a [[treat]] to an [[unappreciative]] [[audience]] {{gloss|due to the gap in knowledge or one's unromanticness}}
